data.text: @lyndseydawnwood @Lisa23489723 @3_resurection Incorrect. PCR tells you if your symptoms are due to covid. PCR is a testing system for covid. It's a reliable test. COVID has been not just isolated but sequenced 3848 times and catalogued by @nextstrain. https://t.co/gvloVvd8Uo
@Lisa23489723 @lyndseydawnwood @3_resurection I'll bite. Why did Kary Mullis say PCR tests detect free infectious virus?

@Lisa23489723 @3_resurection @lyndseydawnwood @nextstrain @US_FDA 4. COVID PCR tests are "in vitro". In a test tube. They're not "in vivo". Nobody sticks a testing machine into a living person's body. The results wouldn't be any more accurate if they could. https://t.co/upZD4pGrAF

@Lisa23489723 @3_resurection @lyndseydawnwood @nextstrain 3. The @US_FDA had previously issued Emergency Use Authorizations for COVID RT-PCR, and started offering full authorization in July.
https://t.co/7oK27e9c58

@Lisa23489723 @3_resurection @lyndseydawnwood 2.  3848 unique variants of "virus" has been isolated, sequenced, and mapped by @nextstrain.
https://t.co/cZCnkSDIcz https://t.co/8FiWjH6kgp

@Lisa23489723 @3_resurection @lyndseydawnwood 1. You can't "get the result you want" no matter "how many times the RNA fragment is amplified" because the primers are extremely specific. They don't amplify non-COVID RNA.
https://t.co/4HMEUb4tx8 https://t.co/Y6PykQJEgj

@Lisa23489723 @3_resurection @lyndseydawnwood More specifically, COVID deniers seem to be confusing a false positive _indication of infection_ with a positive _presentation of symptoms_. PCR reliably indicates infection days before symptoms present.

@Lisa23489723 @3_resurection @lyndseydawnwood PCR tests don't have a false positive problem.
https://t.co/W9jTLVFfvS
@lyndseydawnwood churches are corrupted, their souls removed
@lyndseydawnwood Good point lol if anyone should be quoting biblical stuff it's them and they've had nowt to say. The bible is just a dramatised and garbled history book anyway, they've proved it now
